intro: Antherolophus glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular antherolophus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in the summer. Its leaves are alternate and often have a glandular texture, contributing to its common name. Antherolophus glandulosus is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological roles.
